Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: AndyMaKY
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights in end of March. Good location-even come back at 12pm you found it is very safe in this area coz many tourists still shot photo with the Arc nearby. Close to Metro also. Breakfast-few choices and nearly the same everyday Staff-Most are friendly.Strongly praised the front desk staff reaponaible for the night duty. His name is 'Frank', he is extremely helpful and always showed his sincereity and hospitality. Highyly recommended to others.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: TMERIC
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is about 100m to Arc de triomphe and Champ elysees which is almost perfect location to stay. Rooms are clean , average and good breakfast .... Pay $20-25 more and stay in the Street view rooms which also has great Arc view from their small balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Cecilia's Antiques are a delight”
Reviews.Author: Shepherdess01
Reviews.Content: This hotel is convenient for everything (bank at end of street) via walking (get a good map free from hotel), metro - Arc de Triomphe (travel passes from here - necessity for ease of getting around) and buses. Buses are easy and stops are many and the views brilliant. The hotel is very quiet and in a quiet location as between main steets and this one isn't busy. Due to the street width and buildings other street traffic not noticeable. The bedrooms are quiet and very comfortable and well furnished. My room had a pleasant view of other parts of the hotel, the architecture being such it couldn't help but be nice. It was very hot in Paris in the day but could be cool at night so the air conditioning was a great bonus at any time. Lovely sppacious bathroom with good shelf around basin and decent lighting. Fairly good hanging but more for 1 plus than 2. Safe in room which is necessary to put passport, spare cash, etc. Good mirror on door. Comfortable bed and nice as I discovered I had a double. No garish light as those overhead were small ones all around and then bedside ones if you wished. Good to have a lift because I cannot cary a case with any ease and, after a leg operation I am not too happy on winding staircases, pretty ones or not! Sometimes the staff were female so they wouldn't be too happy carrying your case. The staff are lovely and speak good English should this be required. Breakfast is a buffet, not too much choice but good and there is a toaster! You get a pot of coffee or tea instead of the usual cup only. The decor is lovely and a little quirky - mostly antiques plus a very old piano, which works. Some cased collections such as a model of a sailing ship, some rather lovely Venetian Carnival masks and one framed carnival head with a whirl of sheet music around her. The lamps are also very interesting - go and see! Arc de Triomphe two minutes away herefore Champs Elysee, 20 to Eiffel tower and 15 to concert hall Salle Pleyel (reason for trip) which is on rue du Faubourg St. Honore and therefore near to elegant shopping. Restaurants are about but not plentiful and some food outlets - boulangerie and fruit shop but after all this is a residential area. As such this is an attraction because it is quiet. 24 hour bar but a snack or two would be nice. No large coffee after 8pm only espresso. Beware - all French drinks - any kind - are pricey not so much here but everywhere else. Kettle, coffee, tea and a biscuit in bedroom. Free wi-fi. Television but not excellent choice of channels - could do with a radio. Good for gettting from airport as Airfrance bus right by Arc and near hotel. Distance from Garde du Nord (Eurustar - my train) easy and taxi not pricey and pleasant drivers who are good too. (Bus drivers are excellent too - some sttreets are very narrow.) All-in-all a nice hotel, good area with ease of getting around and worth staying there. I had a good 4 nights. Although it is part of a group - all delightful hotels by the look of the brochure - it is more like a well-run private establishment and you feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff-didn't revert to speaking English if guests struggled with French-always a plus. Big breakfast wide variety, nice old fashioned décor, great location. I would recommend this hotel for couples or small groups.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline11
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this Hotel.We had a lovely room not huge but perfect for 2 people. Very big shower.I Think it has been renovated.The personnel is very nice, helpful.Situated 5 minutes from Arc de Triomphe and metro The buffet breakfast is great A lot of choice.Good service We use to stay at our friends appartment but since they moved we had to find a Hotel .Our choice with booking.com was excellent.We will go back to this Hotel on our next trip.There is a bus service to Charles de Gaulle airport 5 minutes walk from the Hotel Cecilia

Reviews.Title: “Our honeymoon trip”
Reviews.Author: half1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this elegant hotel back in 2000, this hotel is based in central Paris so walking around is a pleasure and the food and drinks in the café's are great.

Reviews.Title: “Location, class and beauty!”
Reviews.Author: Naturefreak
Reviews.Content: This hotel gets high marks! Thanks to all previous reviewers. We did request a view which my son (I traveled with a 7 year old) loved. It has the best location of all the hotels we've stayed in Paris (3x's) and the nicest ambience. It had a terrific bath that we relaxed in after our travels and the front desk was very nice. The breakfast service was outstanding and the men that worked the service there did an outstanding job of caring for the area and keeping it spotless. Our room wasn't big but it was typical Paris standard and we slept like babies and were very comfortable. The only 3 things I would say that were different was 1) the big key (and you leave it at the front desk when you leave for the day) that you use was a bit cumbersome. 2) You need to turn the main switch on by the door for anything to work. 3) Remember that you are on the right side of the Arc (we messed up the first night and went to the left side from the main street Champ Ellese). We highly recommend the Red or Green buses for sightseeing as their tickets are good for 2 days and takes you to the main points of interest. We to the Red (Rouge) bus and were very satisfied with the service (we never waited but 3 minutes for a bus). It was a new way for us to explore the city and though there is quite a bit of traffic, you still see more above ground than underground/Metro (which can be quite smelly). We took the Air France bus to the hotel which was very convenient for the airport and we only walked one short block to our hotel. My favorite part of this hotel was the wonderful feel/look of it but that we had everything that anyone could want and a wonderful breakfast ready for us in the morning. They also serve breakfast until 10:30am which helped, as we did sleep in one day and still could grab some coffee, fruit and pastry before heading out. The front desk person (a man) spoke very good English and was most helpful. He helped us out with using the business center since I was not good at tapping into the free internet. 5 stars for making our trip very comfortable! Wonderfully done, Hotel Cecelia!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: BigBadTone
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Cecilia 4 nights in early January. Wonderful location close to the Arc de Triomphe and within walking distance of most of the Paris sights. Close to Metro station and easy to locate. As expected, many restaurants close by. Paid the extra and had a room fronting Avenue MacMahon which had a small balcony from which we enjoyed a lovely view of the Arc de Triomphe. Comfortable room of reasonable size. Nice breakfast with very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Parisian hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: Olisan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Cecilia in Paris leading a study abroad trip with college students. This hotel is in a wonderful location, and is a good value. The hotel provides a fantastic breakfast. One of the best things about Hotel Cecilia is its staff members; they were helpful, friendly, and worked with us to provide the best possible experience for the groups' leaders and the students. The rooms are very well appointed, with excellent space for Paris. They are renovating one of the floors, so sometimes it can be noisy during the day. Regardless, this fine establishment is a great choice in Paris. I strongly recommend it. As a bonus, it has excellent wifi and easy connectivity with a close metro.

Reviews.Title: “Romatic trip”
Reviews.Author: gezza65
Reviews.Content: What a great Parisian Hotel based in a very good location. We upgraded to a get a view of the Arc De Triomphe and had a balcony where I was proposed to! Rooms were very clean, comfy and the bathroom was excellent. Breakfast was very good and the hotel service was always friendly, helpful and welcoming. We were able to book Airport shuttle bus tickets in reception and leave our luggage for the day, even after booking out. We used the excellent local restaurants and undertook an exceptional walking tour. (booked independently). I would recommend this hotel and definitely hope to return again one day. (who knows on our anniversary)! Helen & Jez.

Reviews.Title: “Very close to the Arc and to the metro.”
Reviews.Author: Danielppa
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice if you are looking for a great location at a fair price. Employees are very helpful and breakfast is great.

Reviews.Title: “Chris B”
Reviews.Author: Chris B
Reviews.Content: What a Gem! In this category this has got to be the best hotel in Paris. Pleasant, helpful and friendly staff, modern, clean and well furnished rooms. To top it all, the hotel is within walking distance of all the major attractions. We will definately be returning.

Reviews.Title: “We have been already 2 times at this wounderful hotel, and will come back this year for another 2 stays”
Reviews.Author: Klaus B
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to have found this cute and romantic hotel, with that marvelous location and direct view to the nearby Arc de Triomphe, and only a 3 minutes walk to the highest point of the Champs Elysees. We came here already two times with groups of Brazilians (26 and 14 people) With this place to stay, you can’t get lost during your visit in Paris, even if you don´t speak French. We will always love to come back to this place, were we have been welcomed with a maximum of friendliness. We are looking forward to our next visits in June and October 2012 – Thanks to the whole team, which do a great job.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but great room w/ outstanding location.”
Reviews.Author: Tony H
Reviews.Content: My 2 teenage daughters and I shared a "triple room" at Hotel Cecilia and we really enjoyed it. The room is large for European standards with a very nice bathroom. What surprised me was how quiet it was in the room and on the balcony (we were not on the street side of the hotel). The staff was very pleasent throughout our stay, and we really enjoyed the daily breakfast with a selection of meats, cheeses and juices. Although a bit on the expensive side, the location makes up for it. Located a very short walk from the Arc de Triomphe and the Metro makes this hotel a great selection for your average sightseeing tourists. I would highly recommend this hotel, and if I ever go to Paris again I'd gladly stay here!

Reviews.Title: “C'est Magnifique!!”
Reviews.Author: GlennandBec
Reviews.Content: We loved every aspect of our stay at Hotel Cecilia. The location could not have been better and really is just a stones throw from The Arc de Triomphe. The Hotel looked so inviting from the outside and entrance and did not disappoint inside. All staff were extremely friendly, welcoming and obliging and the breakfast was delicious. The room was of a good size for a central Paris located Hotel, was comfortable and well presented. When we return to the beautiful city of Paris we will not hesitate to visit Hotel Cecilia once again.

Reviews.Title: “Great tip from a friend”
Reviews.Author: MegaKay
Reviews.Content: We stayed here partly on the strength of a recommendation from a friend, but also because of the location (just near the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees). An additional bonus was its proximity to the Air France shuttle bus Etoile terminus on Avenue Carnot (the next avenue across from Avenue MacMahon). Marie at reception was absolutely wonderful and very welcoming. The room was clean, comfortable (we had a superior) and had a balcony from which we could gawp at the Arc de Triomphe. This was our last night of our European trip, so the location was very special. The hotel has a small "business centre", i.e. an alcove near reception with a computer and printer - very handy for printing out boarding passes (although the keyboard layout is a bit different on French computers, so it took me a little longer than anticipated). Breakfast is included in the room charge and the breakfast room is beautiful with a decent range of foods and drinks. I'm hoping we'll be back there again later this year!

Reviews.Title: “gem”
Reviews.Author: ktraveler_7
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of this cute little property. We had a small bedroom, but a fantastic view of the Arc de Triomphe from our little balcony. The breakfast was included in the price, which makes this a better value than many Paris hotels. We found our room to be clean and tidy and had a very nice bathroom. Most of the staff we encountered were friendly, helpful and happy to speak English, which we appreciated. The ONLY negative thing we encountered was one particular staff member who never smiled at us or anyone else for that matter, and actually seemed annoyed that he had to bring coffee/tea to people at breakfast. When we stopped in the lobby bar for a drink before heading out for the evening, we also felt that it was a 'chore' for him to serve us and we had to literally track him down for anything that we needed. This was so different than the behavior of the rest of the staff that it really stood out. We would definitely recommend the hotel and will probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “everything OK”
Reviews.Author: CatsMilano
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location, very friendly and helpful staff, good breakfast...Our room was only medium-sized (but that's normal for Paris!) but had a quite large bathroom (with double sink) and facing the inner side of the building, so it was really quiet. And at walking distance you can find absolutely everything (small cinema included!)...!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Holidayz2009
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so ideally located. Whilst staying here in December 2011, we were upgraded to a superior room. The room was at the front of thre hotel and featured a cute iron balcony. The view was impressive. The Arc de Triomphe is SO near! It was quite a largeish balcony, we managed to drag two chairs from inside the room onto the balcony in the evening and enjoy the views with a nice hot drink. I have stayed at this hotel before so I knew what to expect. Although the stay before was just in a basic double room. You can definately notice the difference between the two room types that I have stayed in. If the superior is not too much more, then I would recommend paying the extra. The superior room had a gorgeous bathroom with a huge bath. The reception staff are very helpful and friendly. The breakfast had a wide choice... toast, cerial, croissants, pastries, fruit salad etc etc. I enjoyed the breakfast. The hotel does feature a lift to each floor which comes in handy for your tired legs from all the walking around Paris. I have also stayed at the Mac Mahon Hotel which is literally 4 doors away. I would recommend the Cecilia over the Mac Mahon. The Cecilia had much larger rooms. The Mac Mahon had TINY rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff good location”
Reviews.Author: stuartBromley
Reviews.Content: Recently spent a long weekend at the Hotel Cecilia. Travelled by Eurostar from Ebbsfleet to Gard du Nord then caught the Metro (line 2 from La Chapelle) which was a 10 min walk from the entrance to the Metro from the main station. Had bought a book of 10 metro tickets from the information desk at Ebbsfleet (£15) which saved us joining the long queue at the station in Paris. The Metro took approx 20 mins to Charles de Gaulle Etoile station and the walk to the hotel via exit 5 signposted to Carnot was no more than 3 mins. The Hotel is in an excellent position, within sight of the Arc de Triomphe and the reception and staff are very welcoming. We arrived 2 hours before check-in time on the off chance that our room may have been ready. It was not, however the staff offered to lock our bags away to allow us to go off and start exploring. Our room was small but modern, clean and well equipped. Comprising of Tea/coffee making facilities, flat screen TV and a free-to-use digital safe. The buffet breakfast was good, located at the rear of the lobby away from the reception beyond the bar and seating area. Comfortable and cosy All of the staff were very helpful and friendly. I can highly recommend this hotel for its great location for the sites, the Metro and plenty of places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Recent stay at Hotel Cecilia”
Reviews.Author: laxmom
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cecilia was recommended by a friend and I thought we would try it. Last year we stayed in the Hotel Clement in the 6th (St. Germain) which was also recommended by a different friend. The hotel Cecilia was perfect. From the moment we walked into the hotel to the moment we checked out. Marie at the front desk was extremely helpful with directions and suggestions on shopping. Our room was beautiful and our balcony faced the Arc De Triomphe. We stayed there for 2 nights then headed to Beaune before returning to Hotel Cecilia. They allowed us to leave one of our bags there. Our rate included breakfast and it was wonderful. A big selection of fruit, cheses, meats, yogurt, croissants, and cereal. The Air France bus was right around the corner so that made it convenient for transfers to/from the airport. I would definitely return and recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: ken h
Reviews.Content: Our second vist to this perfect hotel.Location excellent very convenient for all the sights.The decor is a charming mix of dark wood older style public rooms but with stylish modern bedrooms and bath rooms.It is a very good idea to pay the extra for a room at the front with views of the Arc de Triomphe and the Aveune MacMahon.All the staff are attentive and polite and add to the enjoyment of your stay.We have visted with our family on the first occasion and as a couple and this last visit and it was very enjoyable on both visits.We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: alfjeni
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend. The location is very good. We had a top floor room with a small balcony and a view of the Arc de Triomphe. The room was very clean with tea and coffee making facilities. The bathroom was a decent size. All areas of the hotel were kept clean. The breakfast was very good and all the staff were helpful. There was no language problems as all the staff spoke English. There is a Metro station a few minutes walk away. Although there are restaurants and bars nearby the prices are very expensive. Certain bars do offer a Happy Hour which makes the drinks a little more affordable. We went the Moulin Rouge for the late show. This was a bit of a disappointment. We had to queue outside for about half an hour before being herded in. Although smart dress is requested most people dress casually. The show did not live up to our expectations for the money we paid. We enjoyed our weekend break and would highly recommend the Hotel Cecelia. It is worth paying the extra £12 a night for a room with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: Beto_Rios
Reviews.Content: This is our third time in this Hotel and it continues to excel in their service, attention and of course, the location is excellent! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend”
Reviews.Author: ravieanne
Reviews.Content: Good breakfast, very central for walking around Paris or travelling on the Metro. Staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: gracie_lamergris
Reviews.Content: I truly enjoyed our 8-night stay at Hotel Cecilia. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and appeared to have been recently renovated. Having the balcony for a little extra per night was, in my opinion, well worth it- with a view of the Arc de Triomphe and surrounding areas. The breakfast was filling and tasty and a bar was available 24/7 for water, wine, etc.. which was nice late at night. You can't beat the location.. The metro is a short walk from the hotel and Champs Elysess is about a five minute walk. On top of all of that, there was free wireless internet :) I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and Quaint”
Reviews.Author: Micha H
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very courteous and helpful. By the second day there they remembered our room numbers and greeted us with a smile. The hotel is beautiful and everything was very clean and tidy. We felt very safe here because you must obtain your room key from the front desk staff upon return, and after a certain time at night they will buzz you in upon identification. Breakfast each morning consisted of breads, cheeses, meats, fruit, juice, coffee, yogurt, etc. It was all we ever needed. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great value. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Wolves83
Reviews.Content: You can see by looking on a map what a fantastic location the Hotel Cecilia is in, it really is incredible to be able to stay so centrally without paying over the odds. It meant for us that we hardly used the metro at all and just walked everywhere we went, which was great. Breakfast was fantastic, a buffet style continental, with fruit, yoghurt, ham, cheese, bread and pastries- really what we needed to start the day. The rooms were fine, we were looking out to the back of the hotel and the room was big enough and again what was needed. When we were there the lift was jot working, which was very clear when booking. This was not a problem in itself but our room was located next to the stairs, and it is amazing how loudly some people can walk up the stairs!! Annoying for us but probably wouldn't be an issue in future. I would advise people to try some of the restaurants on nearby streets that are not for tourists, they are cheaper and also better quality! Altogether would definitely recommend and would definitely stay again. My in laws have stayed a few times and love it. Staff and very helpful also.

Reviews.Title: “Central and Clean”
Reviews.Author: CornwallKernow
Reviews.Content: Recommended by a family member, my wife and I were very happy to stay at this hotel. The location was perfect, metres from a Metro station and within 2 minutes of the Air France bus stop where customers of any airline could get to and from Orly or Charles de Gaulle airports. Though the hotel is not a full-service one, not having a restaurant or a full bar, the continental breakfast served in a room off the reception area was varied and plentiful. Our room on the 3rd floor faced the street so there was continuous traffic noise but the view up the street to the Arc de Triomphe from our juliet balcony made up for that. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was clean and spacious. Staff were pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The best chioce for a quality holiday in Paris with your family.”
Reviews.Author: stavySalonika
Reviews.Content: When travelling with teenagers compromises are forbidden.So if you want your stay in Paris to be a lifetime memory for your teenage kids,without you having to spend a fortune CECILIA hotel is exactly what you are looking for. Excellent location, metro station just round the corner,very safe neighbourhood, makes you stay out as late as you like.Amazing staff, engish speaking, wonderful rooms and delicious breakfast in a wonderful inviro nment.A very home feeling stay , just absolutely NOTHING more you can ask for. Thank you CECILIA we will surely visit again and recomend you to our best friends,without any hestation.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet hotel with a good breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Tugce-S
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed was nice, not a big one but enough for a weekend holiday. There was coffee machine and a TV in the room but no fridge. No noise at all, very peacefull sleep. Really very nice breakfast, we loved it! And additionally a very polite and helpful French lady at the reception plus English speaking. Very nice staff. We stayed in the 4th floor and unfortunately the lift was out of order! It is very close to Arc de Triumph and to Champs-Élysées street. Also 20 mins walking from where the Ryanair bus leaves you! Nice location. Far from the other busy part of the city like Notre Dame and the islands and the bridges. (1.5 hrs on foot) Additionally the zone was one of the neighboorhoods with open restaurants on Sunday!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jd1218
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights on a friends recommendation, the check in was very easy as the girl at the reception spoke very good English. From reading other reviews the rooms in general in Paris seem to be quite small, but was not a problem. The bedroom and the bathroom were spotless, everything was very clean. We had a room with balcony view of the Arc de Triomphe, which was stunning. Breakfast was a cold buffet, which was perfect for us, the fresh rolls were gorgeous! As a previous reviewer said the man who was serving tea/coffee seemed impolite, he didn't come across that way to us, but on the day we were leaving everyone seemed to be having breakfast at the same time, and he was under pressure trying to clear tables, serve tea/coffee, replace cutlery etc, so maybe they would need to put an extra member of staff on to help him out. This hotel is in an excellent spot, a few minutes walk to the Avenue des Champs-Élysées, and the Les Cars Air France bus stop which we used to get to and from CDG was just round the corner at Avenue Carnot. I would definitely use this hotel again on a future trip to the centre of Paris

Reviews.Title: “The Best Location, accomodations, and staff in Paris”
Reviews.Author: timothybailey
Reviews.Content: I reserved 14 rooms in Hotel Cecilia for our group trip. Vivianne, the manager, Stanley, and all of the staff were as cordial and helpful as any hotel staff could possibly be. They were gracious, polite and spoke wonderful english as we mauled the french language. The continental breakfast was "outstanding". If you are looking for a great location near the Arc de Triumphe with the best hotel staff in town, reserve a room at Hotel Cecila. This will be my "home in Paris" everytime I visit. Thanks Vivianne!! Hope to see you again soon. Tim and Emily Bailey

Reviews.Title: “What a great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lynnemezzo
Reviews.Content: We had one night to spend in Paris before returning to the US, and this hotel was recommended to us by my husband's childhood friend, who lives in Paris. Many of her friends have stayed at the Cecilia because of its proximity to the buses which go to Orly and Roissy airports. We trotted up there before we left Paris to go elsewhere and we were greeted warmly by the proprietress, who gave us all the particulars about the triple room we wanted to book (we had lots of luggage and needed the space). The public areas are colorful and inviting, with complimentary newspapers. We reserved the room right then and there, and when we returned, we were shown to a lovely room overlooking an inner court, with a nice balcony. The room was impeccably clean and then bathroom sparkling. The morning breakfast was more than ample with ham, breads, yogurts, and fresh fruit salads, complete with excellent coffee or tea. Another plus of this hotel is the act that tickets for the airport buses are sold at reception, thus negating the need to fish for money later on. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JulieAnnArm
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed in this hotel for two nights in May. Our triple room was big and had a little verandah. It overlooked the inner courtyard and therefore was very quiet. The hotel is conveniently located - two minutes walk to the L'Arc de Triomphe which you can see from the entrance to the hotel. It is also a couple of minutes walk to the Charles de Gaulle metro station. There are numerous cafes and restuarants in close walking distance. Breakfast was very nice with a good selection. The staff was all helpful.

Reviews.Title: “comfort and tranquility”
Reviews.Author: chatterboxLancaster
Reviews.Content: Could not fault this hotel. Round the corner from the drop off by the Air France coach from CDG airport. Short walk to Arc de Triumph and can see it from bedroom window. Selection of bistros close by. Short walk to metro or open top bus tour stops. Hotel beautifully decorated and furnished. Friendly reception & dining room staff. Simple but adequate bedroom (no tea/coffee making facilities), comfortable beds, lovely bathroom, immaculately clean. Good breakfast selection. Wonderful to return to after a hard day's sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Excellent Internet and Location”
Reviews.Author: lakelin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Cecilia for 3 nights with my adult son in a twin facing the street with a balcony. The room was clean, but small - but the french doors that opened to the balcony really added to the experience. The view of the Arc De Triomphe was wonderful, and at night, somewhat magical. The bathroom was huge, modern and very clean. The front desk was staffed by helpful, friendly people who spoke English. We had breakfast there one day and it was decent, although no hot items are available. The website states they have laundry facilities, but this isn't so - what they offer is a laundry "service" that is ridiculously expensive (3.50 Euros to wash one pair of underwear and 12.00 Euros to wash a tee shirt). We did find an automatic laundry not too far away. The street side can be quite noisy - especially with the windows open (we were on the third floor). One night, there was some commotion going on near the Arc that ran into the middle of the night with honking horns, yelling, etc. Overall, this is a nice, clean hotel where we felt comfortable with our basic needs met.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tabby38
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Cecilia for a couple of nights in March 2011. The hotel is in a great location. The hotel room was very clean and comfortable and had a great balcony with a view of the arc de triomphe. All staff we encountered were very polite and helpful. The breakfast served is very good and plentiful. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Paris at The Cecilia.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel in Wonderful Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Karen31367
Reviews.Content: A Four Star Hotel with two star prices! The location is great (just a stone's throw from the Arc de Triomphe). The entire place is charming - a wonderfully decorated lobby and room. The breakfast buffet has many choices and is filling. Couldn't think of any reason to spend big bucks to stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “A typical Parisian hotel with an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: rhinelegend
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Hotel Cecilia Arc de Triomphe. I loved the location of this hotel. Very central and convenient to the best attractions in Paris. The neighborhood around it is also decent and safe. This hotel is fine if you're in Paris with a small family or just for sightseeing. It is not, by any means, a luxury hotel. Rooms are very tiny (as with most Paris hotels, I bet) but well-kept. I would recommend this hotel mainly because of its location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and good value”
Reviews.Author: deb0910
Reviews.Content: My teenaged daughter and I spent 4 nights at the Hotel Cecilia in November 2010. The location was awsome, right near the Champs Elysees, the Arc and the Charles de Gaulle subway. The Air France bus to the airport was a block away and also very convenient. Great pizzas at the cafe around the corner made by Carmelo. The room was big enough and although we had a balcony, it was far too cold to use it. Bathroom was roomy and there was always enough hot water. Breakfast wasn't extensive but was satisfactory. Two tiny gripes. The room was hot and altering the thermostat in the room didn't seem to help. Also, one of the female receptionists wasn't very friendly and actually gave us wrong directions a couple of times which cost us quite a bit of time. Nothing serious, just not what you'd expect given the high standards you otherwise enjoy at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: oritdan
Reviews.Content: Usually we stay in Latin quarter. Thiis visit chose this hotel because we needed to stay near Champs Elysees.The hotel was a great choise, comfortable,close to metro,helpful, english speaking staff. The breakfast was adequate and fulfilling. A safe and coffee/tea facilities would have made our stay perfect

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Ideal for City Break.”
Reviews.Author: ServalKat
Reviews.Content: Around the corner from the Air France Bus that terminates on Av. Carnot and across the street from the metro entrance on Av. De Wagram. Friendly and helpful staff, good breakfast, Luggage room for the last day! Good Bathrooms (good shower, large bath). Lots of mirrors! Plenty of storage space and hangers. Good windows therefore quiet even though we were facing Av Mac Mahon. Good view of Arc de Triomphe when window open. Comfortable beds. Pubic areas of the hotel have character. Agree with other good reviews! Best Hotel of this class I have stayed in in Paris. There are plenty of places to eat near the Hotel if you can't walk another step after sightseeing all day! All that we tried were fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Peaceful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Capital06
Reviews.Content: Very good location, very close to Air France Airport Coaches,metro, RER A to Disneyland, Arc De Triomphe, and charming Champs Elysees, cafes, supermarkets, restaurants. Further more impressive hotel entrance, warm welcome, incredible gentle front desk servants, well concierge, a little bit old classical style furnishing. Breakfast was tasty and satisfying. Rooms are small but convenient, comfy beds. No smoking hotel but in view of entrance door there is a bank for smokers. As a result, this is a typical Paris hotel, romantic and hidden gem.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: guymorcado1983
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in October 2010, leaving just before the open-ended strike, and enjoyed our stay. If we were to return, I think we'd try another neighborhood -- just to try something new, this neighborhood and hotel are very nice. PROS: Staff are relatively friendly and speak English. Bathrooms are extremely large by Paris standards. Rooms with balconies on Mac Mahon have a good view of the Arc, though you will not likely spend much time on the balcony due to the small size and street noise. Travel to and from both airports is super easy via the Air France shuttle, for which the hotel sells tickets. Metro stop located a block or two away. CONS: Some street noise, but this is present in most Paris hotels and the windows are well insulated. Those piercing French police sirens, though, definitely make their way into rooms on Mac Mahon, even when the window is closed. Didn't bother us that much -- one doesn't go to Paris for peace and quiet. Consider if this neighborhood matches what you want from your Paris vacation. It is safe and near the Arc and Champs-Eysees, but beyond those two things (which are low on my list of favorite attractions), neighborhood personality is lacking. The streets around the Arc are larger and there is an enormous roundabout surrounding the Arc, so this neighborhood does not have as much of the charm of the small, cafe-lined streets one pictures when they think of Paris. It's definitely not a bad location at all, especially given the safety and numerous transit options, but the other neighborhoods we visited on the Left Bank were more charming. Overall, would definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: MarissaD0622
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for four nights at the end of a ten day trip to England and Paris. Hotel is very well located - two minute walk to Arc de Triomphe and the Metro stop. Several nearby cafes were convenient. Good breakfast, nice variety. Room was large with plenty of space to store luggage. Very nice bathroom although the shower drained very slowly which required you to be fast when showering to avoid floods! Never asked to have this repaired though so can't really complain. One odd thing - the hotel required you to leave your key (which was very large and bulky) at the front desk when you went out. As the desk is attended 24 hours a day, this wasn't a big deal but sometimes we would have to wait for the attendant to finish helping another guest before getting our key which was a little inconvenient (maybe this is expected in Paris?) Overall, would recommend this hotel to others and would consider staying here for future trips to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “could've been better especially for what i paid”
Reviews.Author: mlrx517
Reviews.Content: First of all, this hotel doesn't allow you to change or postpone a paid reservation. My husband and I forfeited a 5 night stay in Sept, having to postpone it to Oct. We were not allowed to get 1 cent back. Two mornings ago, a couple got scolded for coming to breakfast at 10:25 (breakfast ends at 10:30). It isn't hard to get coffee for a table, I don't know why the waiters brought it up. Thought it was quite rude. Yes it's clean, the front desk staff is nice, great location, it is quite old. My queen bed had a huge dip in the middle and I would find my husband kicking my back in the middle of the night, thinking he was on his side of the bed. The shower panel is useless, the floor was wet all the time. This morning/night I could hear other guests in the their room getting ready to check out. I could hear my next door neighbor brushing his teeth as if he was in my bathroom. Guess the walls/doors aren't sealed well. I've stayed near the Champs and Arc before and don't recall having these problems.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but OLD”
Reviews.Author: bunnyow
Reviews.Content: Stayed in September for my trip to Paris & London. The first room I got when I reached Paris was very small. The subsequent two rooms I stayed after I returned from my side trips were bigger but still old. Location is good as it is just mins walk to shopping and bus stop to board the airport shuttle bus. Very tiny lift, small bed and when u shower the toilet floor will get wet coz the glass panel on the bath tub is too narrow. Breakfast is the same everyday so it is quite boring if u stay too many days in this hotel. If I ever visit Paris again I would choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Civic506
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel was very friendly. They provided a room with balcony view overlooking the avenue (at no extra charge) and we were able to check-in early on the day of arrival. Room 54 is small, as expected when compared to the ones in US, but the bathroom is roomy. The room was clean and the view from the balcony was great. The hotel's location is very good for exploring the city by foot and by metro.

Reviews.Title: “A great find, convenient for all amenities”
Reviews.Author: Jetsetters00
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a weekend in Paris, staying at the Hotel Cecilia. The lounge/dining area and reception are very traditional, which we found charming. Our bedroom was more up to date and although small (typical city size), was nicely decorated and furnished. The bathroom had recently been refurbished and had a large walk in shower. We didn't have a view, as we were at the back of the Hotel, but it was very quiet, so we were able to sleep at night ! The staff in Reception and Dining room were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast did not vary but there was always plenty of fresh fruit salad, yoghurts, cereal,ham,cheese, bread rolls,croissants and pain au chocolat. The Hotel is well situated for the Shuttle bus from Charles de Gaulle,which stops at the Arc de Triomphe , the Metro (follow signs for the exit on Ave de Wagram) and the L'Open Tour bus stops on Champs Elysee and Ave Kleber. We would definately stay here again. We read other reviews before going to Paris and agree that Le Hide restaurant near the Hotel gave excellent value for money. It's 22 euros for 2 courses, starter and mains or mains and dessert which for Paris, is very reasonable and the food was deliscious. Another good find was the Italian restaurant Cesar on right hand side going down Ave de Wagram. Some mains expensive but pizza and pasta dishes reasonable and very tasty. The tiramisu was wonderful even though it cost 8 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Just about perfect”
Reviews.Author: placed
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was perfect for our visit to Paris. The hotel was very clean and the staff could not have been more helpful with advice on where to eat and about the sites etc. We booked with Cresta and breakfast was included. The only reason I haven't given the hotel a 5 is because, as seems to be normal in Paris, there wasn't tea/coffee making facilities in the room. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible location”
Reviews.Author: patbarbar
Reviews.Content: Booked for 3 nights but I had screwed up dates and arrived a day earlier than our reservation. Hotel was full but the staff helped us find a room down the street for the extra night. Rooms are a bit dated but still pretty comfortable. Breakfast was nice. In room wifi was handy too. 2 blocks from the arc de triomphe and metro as well as in the heart of a restaurant and hotel district. Everything you need is nearby including a little fruits market.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Parisian Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TheQuailes
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, the location is perfect for most of the sight seeing in Paris, also close to the Metro and of course the Arc De Triomphe. The staff were really friendly and patient. The rooms were clean and very well laid out. The continental breakfast was lovely and the window fr breakfast was really good 7 - 10.30. Overall a great hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Just want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Sazzie1990
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i stayed at the Cecilia for 2 nights in August 2010 and we found it without fault. The internet deal meant we could afford a 2 night stay and got breakfast from free, despite being a deal the room with spacious and had a view over the Mac Mahon. The area was quiet and had a fantasitc view of the Arc De Triomphe. The staff were very friendly and the hotel spotless. Breakfast didn't include a hot option but the choice of cold options compensated that. If your planning on going sight seeing, the Champs Elysees is a few streets away and the Metro at the end of the street will take you to all major attractions. Will certainly revist next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, great hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: HaynesNottingham_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Cecilia for 4 nights in August 2010. The location was good being so close to the metro station and with nice bars and restaurants in such a short walking distance. The staff were so helpful from the minute we arrived until we left. The hotel was very clean and the room was a good size. We would recommend this hotel and will stay again if we visit Paris in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and pleasant!”
Reviews.Author: Bostonsummertraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for the money. It is very conveniently located near shuttle bus to the airports, subways stations, and all the sights of the Champs Elysee. The staff is pleasant, helpful and friendly. The decor is traditional and our room was moderately sized for this level of hotel. However, the bathroom was huge by Paris standards. In addition, except for the pigeons outside our window, it was quiet and we got a great night's sleep there.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location,friendly helpful staff, very clean comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Dee0562
Reviews.Content: travelled with my daughter birthday trip,perfect location for our sight seeing. hotel staff were very helpful and managed to get us booked in for moulin rouge show which we thoroughly enjoyed expensive but worth it..hotel was very clean and lovely comfortable beds,would definately return to this hotel and we will recommend it to friendsand family.we stayed for 3 nights 26th to 29th july 10.

Reviews.Title: “Great home base for sightseeing.”
Reviews.Author: krkstur
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a good deal in great location. The room is small but the bathroom is quite large. The breakfast in the hotel was pretty basic but we enjoyed the convenience. The front desk staff was overall accomodating, with the younger woman day shift receptionist being extremely friendly. The elevator was extremely small and did not work consistently, and broke down on our last day so we had to bring the luggage down five flights of stairs by ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “It's pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Meadowender
Reviews.Content: Great location, lovely friendly hotel. Lift broken when we arrived and we were on 4th floor. Staff were great help and promised it would be fixed next day and it was. Rooms a bit on the small side but were spotless and have to say it but great aircon and we needed it as it ws very hot when we were there. Breakfast basic but plenty of it. Staff at reception were very helpful and nothing too much trouble for them. As stated location is superb 100 meters from Place Charles De Gaulle Metro. We travelled on Eurostar so was easy from Gare Du Nord about 10 stops. We are hoping to return to Paris in the spring for the rugby intrnational and I will see if the Cecilia is available again. Small basic........ish but fantastic value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: MaritaFagerhaug
Reviews.Content: We were four friends on a weekend trip to Paris. The bus from Charles de Gaulle stops almost right next to the hotel!! Perfect! The staff speaks English and are very helpful. The breakfast is perfect, and the rooms are clean and big enough. We really loved to stay at Cecilia. Perfect location in a nice area of the city. And we found it on Tripadvisor. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful small hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MFBSpringCity
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and another couple stayed at the Hotel Cécilia in May 2010. Judging from the hotel’s website and ratings from other guests, we had high expectations. We were not disappointed. Hotel Cécilia is situated on Avenue Mac-Mahon (an architecturally attractive street) and is only a block or so from the Arc de Triomphe and the Metro. It is a small hotel with a stylish entrance, lobby and bar/sitting area that evoke an elegance one ordinarily would not expect from a three-star hotel in Paris. Our rooms overlooked Mac-Mahon and offered a nice side view of the Arc de Triomphe from our balconies. Traffic noise was not a problem at all at any time of the day or night. While a bit on the small side compared with American hotels, our rooms had ample walking, closet and storage space and decent-sized bathrooms. The décor of the rooms was not as stylish as the common areas on the first floor, but they were still nicely wall-papered and painted. The bed was comfortable and there were extra blankets if needed. The hotel staff could not have been better. They were very polite and engaging and were especially helpful in directing us to restaurants that were off the n . We will visit Paris again and, when we do, we likely will return to Hotel Cécilia. If you decide to stay at Hotel Cécilia, try Le hide (10 Rue du Général Lanrezac), a restaurant around the corner from the hotel that was heartily recommended by one of the hotel’s staff. Like all other restaurants where we ate in Paris and elsewhere in France, it offers two or three fixed price dinners that are drawn from its a la carte menu. Le hide is small and sparsely decorated but has good personalized service and offers very good traditional French cuisine with a bit of an Asian infusion. Also try Bistro Melrose (5 place de Clichy)- about a 15 to 20 minute walk from the funicular serving Sacré Coeur. Nice ambience, great service and excellent food.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, intimate and charming.”
Reviews.Author: Traveljunkie29
Reviews.Content: Located a block from the Arc de Triomphe. Hotel is older, but rooms are quite spacious for Paris. Decor is traditional, but bathroom is fairly modern. Rooms are very clean. Breakfast was excellent with cereals, fruit, yoghurt, cheeses, coldcuts, etc. and terrific croissants! Elevator is very small, almost clausterphobic, but it works. Desk staff was very polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay when in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Effala
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the room, the staff and most of all the delicious generous breakfast. Lots of atmosphere and very convenient to the Metro. This small hotel has everything you need including free wireless.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, location and price”
Reviews.Author: New_Intl_Traveler
Reviews.Content: This was my wife's and my first 'leisure' trip to Paris (I had visited decades ago on business). Although we would be staying for 10 days at a rented apartment with friends we started the trip with a bit of personal time and - placing our trust in Trip Advisor reviews we picked the Hotel Cecilia - it was almost perfect! Although (as with most affordable rooms in a major city) the room was modest in size it was comfortably equipped and had all the modern touches (AC, TV/cable, updated bathroom, etc). The included continental breakfast was very complete and located in a comfortable, pleasant room. The service was excellent in every case - even though my French is abysmal both the desk staff and the wait staff were wonderful. The location is quite fantastic. Convenient to the Arc de Triomphe - Champs Elysees/Ave de la Grand Armee as well as the Metro. The only item that prevented it from being perfect was that our particular room was located on a side of the building that was a bit awkward to get to and was noisy in the mornings (along an alleyway or something). On our next trip (we will definitely stay there again) I think we will try a room on the Ave Mac Mahon.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant,friendly and peaceful hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Vicky249
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel many times since 1993, in itself a recommendation. Rooms have been refurbished and bathrooms updated - immaculately kept. Some bedrooms are small and only have a shower and no bath, but they have plenty of storage. TV has only one English speaking channel (CNN). Breakfast buffet, coffee and croissants/rolls wonderfully fresh and good. Staff friendly and efficient, and have been there for many years

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: PinnerSylv
Reviews.Content: We chose this Hotel because of previous Reviews. It is a lovely, clean and friendly hotel, well situated, the room we had had been recently refurbished and was great. The staff were friendly and helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel for Families - Very Friendly - Good Transport Links”
Reviews.Author: IrishDaddyMummyBaby
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel due to its consistant high rating on tripadvisor, its location and its good price - none of these let us down. Hotel Cecilia is located only about 100m for Arc de Triumph and the CDG Etoile - perfect for getting anywhere in Paris and the terminus for the airfrance airport bus. The RER A Train to Eurodisney is alos in CDG Etoile so perfect for going there in about 40mins - priced only €6.55 for ticket. We stayed with our 2 year old baby and never had any issues with the hotel. We have quite a large pushchair and found that we could store it quite easily in the bath out of the way. Yes the rooms are small but I thisnk most visitors only use them to sleep in. We had room 34 and this afforded us a brill view of the Arc de Triumph and the surronding neighbourhood. There is quite a bit of noise from the road at night however and this is a bit offputting. Our room had a balcony which could be an issue for a large child climbing but a 2 year old was not able to slip under it or climb it. The breakfast was good and staff very helpful/friendly. We stayed 4 nights and the breakfast is the same every morning which gets a bit boring but quality was good. I found the quality of the coffee to be of a poor standard - very week perhaps not filter coffee but granulated nescafe variety, the tea was better but the milk is not at all like Irish/UK milk - much weaker. All in all this is a very good hotel, great value and very fiendly. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location, everything so handy!”
Reviews.Author: clintwestwood
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brilliant. The sense of atmosphere when you enter is second to none. From the decor to the gorgeous bathroom everything is superb. Breakfast buffet is plentyful and the service is excellent. the receptionst was very helpful on places to dine and sightseeing. I would definitely visit this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for our first visit to Paris”
Reviews.Author: Pylos
Reviews.Content: We immediately felt welcome - everyone at reception is extremely helpful and friendly. We paid a little extra to have a room at the front which was well worth it as we had a balcony and a wonderful view of the Arc de Triomph. The road is fairly busy during the day but quiet at night and we were never disturbed by traffic noise either locally or from traffic going round the Arc. The hotel is in an ideal location for site seeing either on foot or by public transport. Breakfasts are fabulous. We loved Paris and will definately stay at Hotel Cecilia on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “a perfect weekend in paris”
Reviews.Author: sharUn1
Reviews.Content: hello all. i was in Paris for a marathon Run. the hotel is located right by the arc de triumph, the start&end of the marathon. my room was very large, with bath tub, very very clean. the staff was very helpful whenever needed, breakfast was perfect, and all n' all i had a perfect stay in Paris allot of it thank's to the convenient hotel. will definitely come their again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location, LOOK NO FURTHER”
Reviews.Author: dbarnett
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel based on reviews from Trip Advisor. We were NOT disappointed. From the easy ride from the airport (Air France bus # 2), to the always-smiling, helpful staff (special thanks to Marie!!), to the charm of the hotel itself, we could not have been more pleased. This was our first trip to Paris and were somewhat concerned about navigating the city. But, with major metro lines just a few feet away (about the length of a football field) and a map, my wife and I traveled all over the city. As soon as you leave the hotel you'll see the Arc De Triomphe. As you get closer to the Arc, you'll see the Eiffel Tower in the background, to the right. The rooms were clean and comfortable, certainly smaller than what you might find in many US hotels, but typical for Paris. I'd like to give this hotel 6 or 7 stars, but the rating only goes to 5.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Adjmeister
Reviews.Content: Me and my now Fiancee stayed here over Valentines. The hotel has everything you need while in Paris. A bar, breakfast area and your room. The room we was in had a great view of the Arc de Triumphe which was amazing. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was huge! Breakfast in the morning was the usual selection of cold hams with croissants and bread rolls with fresh tea and coffee. It was very tasty with fresh rolls every morning. The location is perfect. 2 minutes walk to the Arc de Triumphe which has a metro station or a couple more minutes walk and your walking down the champs elysees. There are plenty of restaurants and bars around the area to enjoy. Check in and out was a breeze and very welcoming. We left our camera on the bar before we left and only noticed at the airport. We phoned reception and they had already placed it in the safe and we send it to our address for 15 euros. Great service. Oh I forgot to mention free WIFI When we go back I wolud stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: BillanJulie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Cecilia for three nights and thought it was excellent. Superbly located just a hundred yards from the Arc de Triomphe and the Air France bus stop. The nearby Metro station gives access to most of the major landmarks without needing to change at other stations. Our room was small but well furnished and spotlessly clean. Lovely modern bathroom. Breakfast was standard but well presented and efficiently served - you could have breakfast in your room if you preferred at no extra charge. Reception staff very pleasant and helpful - everything seemed very well organised. Couldn't fault for the price

Reviews.Title: “Perfect gem in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: PatrickStafford
Reviews.Content: We loved the Cecilia - beautifully clean and comfortable. Friendly and welcoming staff and ideally situated with the Arc de Triomphe 100 metres away. It is small and stylish (apart from the numerous displays of artificial flowers) and is in a quiet and safe area even though the Champs Elysees is just across the road. Good continental breakfast with fresh fruit etc. We would definitely choose to stay at the Cecilia next time we visited Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Paris”
Reviews.Author: dobedobedo
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Cecilia for 5 nights and can confirm previous reviews: very clean, beautifully furnished hotel with quite large (for Paris) rooms in safe location with all-you-can-eat buffet breakfast and very friendly English-speaking staff - Just perfect. Recommend Air France bus no 2 if travelling from airport (irrespective of what airline you fly with) - Buy return ticket from driver (cheaper than 2 singles) and in under an hour you should be at Etoile (ie Arc de Triomphe) and 50 yards from Hotel Cecilia. Would also recommend walking wherever possible. But take it easy and buy multi-day ticket for metro so you can hop on and off at start/finish points for walks in the many beautiful areas to be visited in a simply unforgettable city. Bon voyage!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: AyeReady1873
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review on behalf of my parents, who have just returned from Paris. I had booked this hotel, based on previous reviews, for a special treat for my parent 50th Wedding Anniversary. The staff were very helpful in advance, arranging for payment to be made from my credit card, once my parents had checked out. I received good communication from them and everything has gone smoothly. My parents were very happy with the Hotel and Staff and couldn't find any fault. They had a nice view from the balcony of the Arc de Triomphe and although the bedroom was not large, it was enough for their two night stay. The also commented on how clean the Hotel was. They also enjoyed the large bathtub and made comment about the bathroom being almost the same size of the room. They would certainly recommend the Hotel to others and would have no hesitation in staying here again. Overall it was great value for money (especially when it was myself & my wife that were paying) I would also like to mention Parishuttle in this review. I was very wary of booking a transfer with the Shuttle companies, after reading some very bad reviews. In the end, I decided to plump for Parishuttle and kept my fingers crossed. My dad called the company as soon as he arrived in baggage claim and they told them exactly where to go on leaving the Airport. The minibusarrived promptly and they were lucky to be the first dro-off at their Hotel. The Hotel receptionist called again the following morning on behalf of my parents and the shuttle service confirmed Hotel collection for 5pm the following day. Again they turned up promptly and got my parents to the Airport in plenty of time. First class service and worthy of a mention on this post.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic hotel, the characters of Remarque lived somewhere nearby”
Reviews.Author: Mikhail1984
Reviews.Content: Great service and warm welcome! The hotel is very clean! Awesome view from the balcony of our room including the Arc de Triomphe! Perfect location: just find the Arc, the hotel is 3 minutes walk from it! Nice full-size breakfast! Tasty food in tasteful interior!

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Stay in a Very fine Hotel in a Wonderful City”
Reviews.Author: MidwestMuggins
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed eight nights in early January at the Hotel Cecilia. This was our second visit as we had stayed at the Cecilia in the late summer of 1973. The room we had for this trip was very comforatble and we had a lovely view of Avenue Mac Mahon from our 5th floor location. The staff is excellent and very helpful as we planned our visits to museums and resaurants. We enjoyed the buffet breakfast each morning. The location is ideal for visiting the museums and all of the sights that one can experience in Paris. At the Arc De Triomphe that is very close by, one can look down The Avenue des Champs-Élysées today and yet still imagine the feelings of the citizens of Paris and the French and Allied soldiers who marched down this Avenue in a victory parade in August 1944 to celebrate the liberation of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel - top location”
Reviews.Author: Frowson
Reviews.Content: Lovely place. Friendly welcome, clean and tidy bedroom, more than adequate bathroom with a very powerful shower which helped after wandering the city all day! Located a matter of yards from the Charles de Gaulle Etoile Metro station which was a perfect base from which to explore Paris. We stayed in room 34 which faced the street and provided a perfect view of the Arc de Triomphe. The buffet breakfast was a little basic but certainly set me up for a day's exploring! All in all a great little place and one me and my partner will certainly return to when we visit Paris again

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Hana88
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fair priced in comparisson to many hotels in paris. Location was perfect and in walking distance to most attractions. The hotel was clean and could get a perfect nights sleep. the staff were very polite and helpful and the continental breakfast was always fresh. Went with my partner for his birthday and it was lovely!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Marbesa
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Cecilia at the end of November. We stayed in rooms 25 & 26 on the second floor, good sized rooms and nicely furnished with large bathrooms with a bath and shower. The hotel is in an ideal position and is clean, warm and friendly! The breakfast was good and set us up well for the hectic touring that we did. A special treat was the close proximity to the Champs de Elysees and the beautiful Christmas lights that were there. There was a big Christmas market at the end of the Champs which was a nice surprise, we have visit the markets in Germany and been disappointed, but this one was affordable and quite spectacular. We didn't manage to use the Metro without getting lost, but we are seniors!! We found the Paris restaurants near the hotel rather expensive and very hit and miss. Better to eat at the Notre Dam area where there are more restaurants giving a better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: fakelvis
Reviews.Content: For a Parisian hotel, the rooms here were larger than expected (although still small compared to some cities). However the room was clean, the bed comfortable, and the bathroom spacious and clean. The staff were helpful, the breakfast sufficient (continental only, no hot food) and overall the hotel was exactly what you need. The location was perfect: a few minutes from the Arc de Triomph, perfect as a location to discover Paris. If it's a double room you are after, room 33 has balcony views of the Arc de Triomph. Well worth asking for. I cannot complain about a single aspect of my stay here: perfect for what my girlfriend and I needed.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended for location and quality”
Reviews.Author: MartinWoods_UK
Reviews.Content: I would recommend Cecilia without hesitation for a short break in Paris. My wife and I stayed 3 nights from 14th November 2009. Room 24 was a decent enough size, how much room do you need? The bed was super wide and the bathroom was very large for a hotel bathroom (bigger than ours at home) Everything was spotlessly clean, the room was cleaned every day and fresh towels were provided. Our room had a small balcony looking out onto the street and you could see the Arc de Triumph from there. The road outside could get quite noisey but the sound proofing of the windows/doors onto the balcony and street was incredible which meant we were not disturbed at all by rush hour traffic. Previous reviewers say the metro is 3 minutes walk away, only if you walk very slowly :) it's only about 150 yards to the Metro at Arc de Triumph - station is called Charles de Gaul Etoille. The bus stop for the Air France shuttle to Charles de Gaul airport is just round the corner and is very handy. We walked all over the city from this hotel and on other days used the Metro, everywhere is easily accesible and we felt safe the whole time we were in Paris. Staff at the hotel are very friendly and helpful and speak English well. If I have any criticism at all it would be that for a small price they could put a kettle and cups in the rooms so guests can make themselves a brew after a long day in Paris. We took our own tea bags and reception staff provided tea pots and hot water from the kitchen which was nice of them but made the whole process so much longer and more hassle than just brewing up in the room. The only other chnage I would make is to the bar. The bar/lounge area is very nice and we would have liked to sit down there and chat with other guests but it seems nobody makes use of the area in the evenings and I think it is due to the very high bar prices, why try and sell at high prices and get no customers? sell drinks cheaply and people would stay around and have a drink and create a nice atmosphere and it would be a nice refuge from the rest of high priced Paris to return to after a meal at a restaurant nearby. All in all it was a lovely hotel to stay in, we had a great time in Paris and we would love to be back there again already, we will use the same hotel again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Savitar
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at Hotel Cecilia in mid November 2009 for three nights. We hunted around different places (including Trip advisor of course) and came across this as a very well reviewed hotel with a reasonable price (109 euro a night inc breakfast) so decided to give it a try. Location wise it was great, right near the Arc De Triumph and about a 3-4 min walk from the nearest metro (which also happens to have the RER go through there, fantastic if you are coming from the airport or from Gard du nord) The hotel staff were very friendly and spoke quite good English when my limited French stopped working! I booked through their hotel and asked for a street facing room on a high floor. We ended up with a street facing hotel (so you can see the Arch from the balcony) on the top floor so was very impressed with that. The room itself was quite small (no surprises there) but the bathroom was HUGE (if very dated as it looks like it was built / renovated in the 60's, 70's). Both the bathroom and bedroom were VERY clean and kept very professionally clean by the staff. Even though the website says "Satellite TV" is included, there is only 1 channel in English and that was CNN news. The hotels website also said that there was free internet but it was broken the whole time we were there and there was a card in the room saying you had to pay for the internet (so I am not sure if it was free or not). Breakfast was actually very nice with a great spread of fresh fruit salad, cold meats (ham etc) pastries, cereal, juices etc. I was expecting something a little less tasty so was pleasantly surprised. There is a shop just around the corner that is open late (we went there at 11:30pm) that has the basic coke, wine, snacks etc so that is very handy! (go out the front door, turn left, go to the first street and turn left, its on the right about 100 m down) All in all I would highly recommend Hotel Cecilia for a short stay in Paris when on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “Made our holiday.”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandAndrew
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff, very helpful,accomodating and friendly. close to all tourist attractions,well within walking distance,surrounded by local cafes/restaurants which made our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Bambewhistle
Reviews.Content: I spent one night here in Room 33, a well sized room for the two of us (neither of us felt it was small), lovely bathroom (combined shower/bath, very good actually) which was generously sized and we had a balcony overlooking the street from where you could easily see the Arc de Triomphe. Everything was very clean and fresh, staff were generally very helpful and lovely (though the breakfast waiter was a little too formal for my personal liking... but that is not to begrudge him as he did very promptly bring our tea...). Decor was very good too. Location is good with the Charles de Gaulle Metro within a few minutes walking distance. I'm looking quite forward to staying at the Hotel Cecilia again and for longer!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: NanaOB
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 22 and had a great view of the Arc from a small balcony. The large french doors were insulated and sound proofed. We travel with a white noise machine so that also helped. It was more spacious than we've encountered with other European hotels and we were happy to see actual closet space with a lot of shelves. The mirrored doors also gave the room a larger feel. The bathroom was gorgeous with lots of counter space and the a/c was working well. There were so many pleasant surprises for this price range, we were thrilled. Our friends paid twice as much and didn't have any more space or view. We also loved that it was a block from the Air France bus stop which takes around 45 minutes to CDG stopping once or twice. Anyone can use the service, it's very reasonable, comfortable, easy to locate and leaves every half hour. Our friends had to pay 80 euros for a taxi one way. The only minor complaint is that the mattresses were a bit thin and not as comfortable as we're accustomed to and there was no kettle or small fridge as some places had, but we slept just fine and were able to get coffee and ice from the breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: annieloo100
Reviews.Content: Have recently returned home following a long weekend in Paris to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary! Booked this hotel after reading previous reviews and was not disappointed! Hotel location - superb! Room was spotless with lovely view of the arc de triomphe, the bathroom was roomie and spotless too! Breakfast was more than adequate and all the staff were friendly and helpful. Also, we found it useful to be allowed to leave our luggage in a secure locked room after checking out of our room, as we were on a night flight home! The only thing I would like to see would be tea/coffe making facilities in the rooms! Will definately be back!! Have recommended it to friends already!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Aussie-Traveller3121
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked the Cecilia after reading reviews posted on Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed. Our room was situated on the fifth floor of the hotel, with our own private walk-out balcony, with a million dollar view of the Arc de Triomphe (especially at night). The hotel is ideally located, being very close (100 metres) to Air France Bus stop (ideal for getting to/from major airports) and similar distance to Paris Metro (underground rail). Plenty of restaurants etc in surrounding streets. Our room was very comfortable with plenty of room and large bathroom (bath and separate shower) as well as other expected amenities. Breakfast was included in our room rate,which was a typical French breakfast and satisfactory. The staff were also friendly. Overall we found the Cecilia to be a first class hotel for a visit to Paris and we would have no hesitation in booking here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful staff, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: hsk153
Reviews.Content: Charming. Cozy. Delightful. Renovated...All necessary amenitites. No complaints. Look forward to staying here again. Convenient for: walking, RER, Metro, CDG Air France bus, shuttle. Restaurants and shopping nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Hotel and Location....”
Reviews.Author: Siangiles1
Reviews.Content: My Mother and I stayed at the Hotel Cecilia for 2 nights and 3 days in Paris from 4th-6th September 09. Its a lovely, traditional hotel with loads of antiques and the building is victorian era I think. We had a small room but we weren't complaining as we had so much to see and do in Paris and all we would be doing in the Hotel is sleeping and eating breakfast. Staff very helpful, friendly and speak good english. You step outside the hotel and look to your right a few yards or so walk and the Arc De Triomphe is there in front of you, tour buses are on Champ Elysees Avenue. Loads and loads of cafes/restaurants where you can eat. On the street where the hotel is located there is a small bar/cafe on the corner which is lovely. If you go around the corner of the cafe/bar, there is a lovely resaurant a few steps away. Everything was postive about the hotel, I would recommend though that the hotel should maybe do Tea/Coffee Facilities in the rooms, but it wasn't a major issue as you could get tea/coffee delivered to your room from 8am til 8pm. We booked our trip through a local Going Places travel agent. We booked flights/hotel and 2 tickets for hop on/off tour bus for £311.00 each.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: nigel4carol
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews i was sure we would not be dissapointed. The hotel and staff are perfect for a trip to Paris , the location is superb for many attractions which can all be reached on foot. The room was very clean and the bathroom nice and roomie. The staff were very friendly and helpfull with directions and tips for seeing the city. We had been warned that it would be expensive to eat out, but very close to the hotel we came across a place to eat. For 10 Euros you could have a starter and main or main and dessert with a drink , you could choose from 5 main courses all of which we tasted. It might not be Al Cart but it was wholesome and very good value. If interested give it a go, as you come out of the hotel turn right up the hill,take the first turning on the left and walk along to the next junction. Turn left again past the entrance to the Quick Hamburger shop and its on your left. I would definetly go to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CrystalCity
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a wonderful stay at Hotel Cecilia in July/August 2009 and am already planning a return trip! It's major selling points are: - Its central, safe & convenient location - The friendly, helpful and professional staff - The spotlessly clean rooms - The relaxed atmosphere I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend!

Reviews.Title: “We would certainly stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: helenbubbles
Reviews.Content: Top marks for this hotel. It was excellent value for money. All staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel was charming, pleasantly decorated and centrally located near the metro and Arc De Triomph. The room was clean (daily maid service) and had everything we needed. Really pleased that this hotel was non smoking as we had read some reviews about other hotels in Paris that stank of cigarettes: this was not the case here. We found the bed very comfortable and the air con was superb - a real bonus in the height of Summer. Very peaceful for a quiet night's sleep - what you need for all the walking you'll do! Breakfast was croissants, breads, pastries, cheeses, cold meats, yougurts, cereals, toast etc and was included in our price. The bar was available 24 hours a day and we found the prices reasonable when compared with the rest of Paris. Wi-fi was good. The shuttle was available to the airport but it was half the price to get the RER train and not much more effort. We reccomend using the small supermarket round the corner to buy water etc for during the day as prices in the city are much higher: up to 5 euros for a coke.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful View”
Reviews.Author: DLO3
Reviews.Content: We requested the 5th floor with view of the Arc... WOW! The hotel is very clean and the rooms are spacious. The view from the balcony was awesome!! Great location!!

Reviews.Title: “good value and location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: travelz4culture
Reviews.Content: This is a 3-star, small little hotel approximately 1 block from the Arch De Triomphe and 2 blocks from the start of the Champs D'Elysses, which is a great base from which to explore Paris. I stayed here on the strength of the reviews on this site and I was not disappointed. While the room was small and the hotel does not have some of the extras of a higher star rated hotel, the excellent value, location and assistance of the staff more than compensates for the lack of luxury that a higher class hotel may have. As mentioned in many other reviews, the location is excellent. The hotel is one street over from the Metro, the train line and the Air France shuttle bus service that takes anyone (not just Air France passengers) into Paris for a small fee.
