The Metro station happens to be the point where at least 2 of the main lines through the parts of Paris that most tourists would want to see. So, it is only a 10-minute metro ride to the Eiffel Tower, Louvre and island on which Notre Dame and St. Chappelle are located. Plus, the hotel is literally a short walk to the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs D'Elysse for some good shopping and people watching. The staff is very good and all speak excellent English. One evening we asked for a dinner recommendation and were given 2 local restaurants within 2 blocks of the hotel. The dinner at LeHide was perhaps the best we had in Paris and the rest of our stay in Cannes. So, I recommend asking for LeHide, which is on the same block as this Hotel, just around the corner on the opposite side of a little side street. We had a 2-course meal for 2, with 2 glasses of wine for under 80 euro, which for an authentic meal in Paris is a great price. I highly recommend this Hotel if one is looking for a good value (rates were approximately $120 euro per night when we stayed) in very expensive Paris.

Reviews.Title: “nice little hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: yf_chua
Reviews.Content: This is a nice decorated hotel, as usual the hotel room is small but not a issue with me. Great location. near the Arc De Triomphe, just a stone throw away.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - close to the Arc”
Reviews.Author: BigDogDaddy31
Reviews.Content: As everyone else has said, this is a great little botique hotel within about 100m of the Arc de Triomphe. It is a typical European, and thereby Paris, hotel: no particular frills - spartan but comfortable. You can take the AirFrance coach from CDG airport to within one block from the hotel for relatively nothing - very convenient. The hotel sits in the middle of the block, and the Metro (Charles de Gaule Etoile) is at the end of the block on the opposite side of the street. Very convenient. The rooms are very small, and some have balconies, but the balconies are literally only big enough to wedge the desk chair onto so you can enjoy the outdoors. If you are a "balcony" person as my wife and I are, this was a bit disappointing, but certainly not a reason to ignore this hotel. All in all, if you are looking for a reliable quality botique hotel with convenient Metro access in the city for a reasonable rate, you can't do much better than this hotel. We would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: LadyFigurine
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location and close to a metro station. The staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms are small but comfortable. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and look forward to returning to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel in a quiet area just off the Arc de Triomphe”
Reviews.Author: tc_bubbenhall
Reviews.Content: It was just as everyone describes, a nice small hotel, well run, friendly staff and I would recommend it for any couple looking for a base for sightseeing. The Air France coach from both airports is 100m away, the Open Top bus tour is just around the corner, everything is nearby to use as a sightseeing base and there are some nice restaurants in the area. Like many Paris hotels the rooms are quite small but we had a room on the back and it was very quiet considering you are only 100m from the Arc.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, traditional and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: GillianGillian
Reviews.Content: Being a 26 year old female and travelling alone I wanted to be sure I would find somewhere very central and safe. The reviews have all been correct and I'm so pleased I wenrt to Hotel Cecila. The hotel perfectly situated minutes from the Arc de Triomphe. It take 2-3 minutes to walk to the nearest metro CDG etolie and the little avenues nearby are all so warm and friendly. The staff at the hotel were very helpful and understanding. The room was small but this is the norm for paris no matter where you go unless you pay the earth. But I requested a big bed and a view of the avenue and it was amazing. My balcony looked over the streets and rooftops of paris and the famour Arc de tri was clear in sight. The breakfast was simple but freash and tasty. The decor quite tradional and old fashioned but it's warm and welcoming. Being a modern young women i found this very interesting and felt very comfortable. I would certainly tell anyone who is going to Paris to visit this friendly cosy little hotel. Please note its only 20 min by metro fro Gard de nord (eurostar) and is very easy to find.

Reviews.Title: “everything you need in a hotel + more!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mosean3434
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 15th -18th march. We were greeted with warmth and friendliness from when we arrived until we left. The location of the hotel is perfect as its just a short walk from the `hop off hop on bus` at the top of champs elysees which we used every day while in Paris (a cheap way to see the sights).Breakfasts are excellent with a super selection to choose from. Avoid the bar, as it only offers minatures at silly prices. Rooms are small, although the bathrooms are large and modern,as said in earlier reviews. We had 2 rooms at front which gave great views of Arc De Triomphe,but can be a wee bit noisy first thing in morning(but did`nt bother us that much)will go again

Reviews.Title: “A lovely little hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Katherine_9
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from four nights in this lovely, friendly little hotel, which is a couple of minutes walk from L'Arc de Triomphe. The local metro station is on 3 different lines, giving easy access to many different parts of the city. Our room was comfortable and cosy, with a nice big, well equipped bathroom.Our room was at the back of the hotel, with no view, but it was incredibly quiet at night, and good thick curtains made it totally dark. We had a great few days and we would thoroughly recommend the Hotel Cecilia. Richard and Anne

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - charming staff”
Reviews.Author: Jennylunn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at the Cecilia in January 2009. We were attracted to the hotel by the location as well as the very good reviews on Trip Advisor, and we were not disappointed. We would agree with all the positive comments. The location was excellent: close to the Arc de Triomphe, Champs Elysees and the metro station; the rooms were comfortable and very warm (it was freezing outside!) ; the bathroom was well equipped; the breakfasts were good, and the staff were helpful, pleasant and charming. They showed us where to go to buy tickets for the Louvre and were helpful with advice and suggestions, particularly as there was a general strike on our last day and we were concerned about getting to the Gare du Nord in time to catch the Eurostar. The hotel was of a very good standard for a 3 star, and we would definitely stay there again and would recommend the hotel to our friends. We look forward to our next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - warm reception”
Reviews.Author: WarwickshireGuru
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cecilia is 2 minutes walk from the Arc de Triomphe, Champs Elysees & the nearest Metro station (Charles de Gaulle Etoile). The hotel itself has a warm feel and is elegantly furnished. The staff were all exceptional, very friendly and very helpful for local information. Will definitely go again......

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: DRS48
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cecilia is excellently located - within sight of the Arc de Triomphe and within walking distance of Eiffel Tower. The room was clean, warm and of average size for a European hotel. The bath room was more than adequate. We had a room on the front and could hear the traffic noise but it was not bothersome. Breakfast provided a very good start to the day - and was always fresh and the staff were very attentative to the needs of the diners - never letting anything even get near to empty. We enjoyed walking down Mac Mahon Avenue in the opposite direction of the Arc and finding eating places as well as shopping all within a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Riley100Cornwall
Reviews.Content: If location and ease is important to you, Hotel Cecilia is definitely right for you...buses from CDG Airport stop literally steps from the hotel, the Arc de Triomphe can be photographed from the room balconies and the Metro is at the end of the road. Our room was a good size and well equipped and the hotel interior is very Parisian. Breakfast was included in the room price and certainly set us up for the day - think unlimited supplies of croissants and pain au chocolats! Although there isn't an in-house restaurant for evening meals there are lots of high quality restaurants nearby which are fun discovering. Couldn't recommend this hotel anymore highly!!!

Reviews.Title: “5 star staff”
Reviews.Author: beebunny
Reviews.Content: travelled the world (int'l flight attendant)--looking for a hotel to recommend to friends and family--criteria--had to have convenient location--proximity to metro--transportation to airport--clean room (extremely important)--great value--friendly and helpful staff--found it!! --the staff at the Cecilia (especially Vivian, Marie and Lucy were extremely helpful and pleasant--enjoyed the breakfast each day--i will wholeheartedly recommend the Cecilia Hotel to friends and family and look forward to returning to Paris and another great stay at the Cecilia. BW USA

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations! Amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: travellingonceagain
Reviews.Content: I have never felt inclined to write, or had any desire to write, a review in my life but my experience of this hotel has compelled me to do so. I have never been to Paris before and thought I would take my girlfriend there for her birthday for the weekend. After scanning the internet for a while I came across this hotel and found a great deal. It looked like an amazing location and near the coach stop to our airport (Beauvais). I wanted everything to be perfect for the weekend so put alot of time and thought into finding the right place to stay. Upon arrival we were mazed by the location, right next to the Arc which meant, apart from anything else, it was very quick and easy to find in a huge city that was new to us. The hotel was welcoming, very smart and had a very unique (beautique as my girlfriend described it) vibe to it which made it all the more romantic. Our room overlooked the Arc, was spacious, clean and the bathroom was also spacious and very clean. The staff could not have been more helpful and the breakfast (which was inclusive) was simple yet very filling. I cannot recommend this hotel enough, especially if you are looking for a romantic weekend as we were. I have no criticisms and the location and staff make this the perfect hotel for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for us!!”
Reviews.Author: cgsNH
Reviews.Content: I'm not one to write reviews, but I thought the Hotel Cecilia was worth recommending! It was an easy trip from the train station to the hotel by Metro, and never having been to Paris, coming out of the Metro at night to see the Arc and Champs Elysées all it up and our hotel right there was amazing. Between the great location, welcoming lobby, clean twin room and a large modern bath , it was much more than I expected for the price (106e/night), especially since this included breakfast. Our 4th floor room faced the back, rather than the Arc, but with huge pull in windows overlooking the little courtyard, balconies and colored glass windows it was perfect and peaceful! We really only used the hotel to clean up and relax between sightseeing during our weekend, so I can't comment on ammenities such as the bar, internet access etc., but it was great for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: KRD_NC
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Cecilia was recommended to us by a friend of one of our 4 group members. We had no idea even with her positive recommendation that we would be as pleased with the hotel as we were. The location was perfect. The rooms were great and the bathrooms very large and modern. The staff could not have been more helpful with their restaurant recommendations and general info about transportation and the things that first-time travelers to an area needed. The first 3 of our 4 to arrive did not speak French but it was not a problem. We checked out of the Cecilia on Sunday morning after 2 nights to travel to southern France but had made reservations for the night before we were to leave as we were flying out of Charles de Gaulle airport. They allowed us to leave luggage that we did not need in their storage area while we were gone. When we returned on Wednesday afternoon, they handed us our keys, asked about our trip and immediately told us where to find our rooms - no signatures required. We opted for the breakfast buffet which was really great: coffee, assortment of juices, croissants, yogurts, fruit, cheese, jellies and jams, toast... We could not have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Laundry room?”
Reviews.Author: barbara_hackett
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a three night stay in Hotel Cecilia , Paris for my 40th birthday. When greeted at reception, we were immediately advised that our room was exactly the same as other rooms except that it was on the ground floor - which we thought was very strange at the time - not so. Our room was accessed through the reception area and we felt like we were second class citizens staying in the laundry room/broom cupboard. The room was small and tired. The toilet had been pushed into a corner behind the door which was difficult to access. Couldnt even sit down properly. We were very disappointed in the standard of the room - we paid dear for this accommodation and it certainly was not worth it! We will be passing this information on to our travel agent. However, the location of the hotel was excellent. If we had been presented with a room which was not through the reception area I have no doubt the whole experience would have been more pleasant.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Cecilia Arc De Triomphe
HotelInfo.Address: 11, Avenue Mac-Mahon | 17 Arr., 75017 Paris, France
